title: Kashmir Valley
summary: The Kashmir Valley, also known as the Vale of Kashmir, is an intermontane valley in Kashmir.  It is in a region administered by India as the union territory of  Jammu and Kashmir, which has been the subject of a dispute between India and Pakistan.[1][2] The valley is bounded on the southwest by the Pir Panjal Range and on the northeast by the main Himalayas range. It is approximately 135 km (84 mi) long and 32 km (20 mi) wide, and drained by the Jhelum River.[3]
